isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Cylinder Head And Valves - Valves - Refacing

note.para: Intake and exhaust valves have the same stem length and diameter. However, the exhaust valve has a dimple on the bottom of the valve.

step1.para: Use a dressing stud attachment or grinder to dress the cutting stone.
Place the valve in the grinder collet set to the specified angle. Turn on the cutting oil.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, the minimum valve face margin must be maintained across the entire valve face. An insufficient margin will not provide proper heat dissipation and will lead to valve warp or breakage.

note.para: Intake and exhaust valve margins and valve face angles are different. See the Specifications for the correct measurements for each.

step1.para: Grind the valve face. Remove only the minimum amount of material that is necessary to true the valve face. Record the amount of material removed for later reference during valve stem resurfacing.
Use a caliper to measure the valve face margin at four locations. Replace the valve if the margin is less than the specification after grinding.

note.para: Refacing the valve stem tip provides a new wear surface for the valve lever and compensates for material that was removed during the valve refacing.

step1.para: Dress the cutting stone by moving the dressing stud attachment across the face of the cutting stone until a uniform grinding surface is achieved.
Place the intake or exhaust valve into the valve stem clamping "V." Turn on the cutting oil.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage when resurfacing the valve stem tip, leave sufficient material so the valve lever does not contact the valve spring, retainers, or rotators during operation.

step1.para: Touch the valve stem tip to the cutting stone. Remove only a minimum amount of material. Do not remove more material than was removed at the valve face.
